definition[0]: a type of lawyer in Britain who gives legal advice, prepares the necessary documents when property is bought or sold, and defends people, especially in the lower courts of law
example[0]: You need to see a solicitor.
definition[1]: someone who goes from place to place trying to sell goods or services
example[2]: A sign on the door read, ‘No Solicitors’.
